item.title: RS2 Client Version Checker?
item.dc:creator: @ruler ruler
item.description:
@ruler wrote:

[quote=“BAsh, post:29, topic:211431”]Ruler’s code will work but it is absolutely horrendous. I was going to repeat my comment from the client-server communication thread but needless to say I hate it.

Use the API and stop farting around with your shitty loops.[/quote]
Can you show me how to use the API instead of loops?

frank after finally reading the code and agreeing it worked offered a improvement.

package impsoft.updater.ruler;

import java.util.ArrayList;

import org.apache.bcel.classfile.Method;
import org.apache.bcel.generic.ClassGen;
import org.apache.bcel.generic.Instruction;
import org.apache.bcel.generic.MethodGen;
import org.apache.bcel.generic.SIPUSH;

public class Version {
   public static final int lastKnownClientVersion = 500;

   public static int getVersion(ClassGenList cgs) {
      ClassGen client = cgs.findClass("client");
      for (Method m : client.getMethods()) {
         if (m.getName().equals("main")) {
            ArrayList<Short> shorts = new ArrayList<Short>();
            for (Instruction i : (new MethodGen(m, client.getClassName(), client.getConstantPool())).getInstructionList().getInstructions()) {
               if (i instanceof SIPUSH) {
                  shorts.add(((SIPUSH) i).getValue().shortValue());
               }
            }
            shorts.remove(new Short((short) 503));
            shorts.remove(new Short((short) 765));
            for (int i = 0; i < shorts.size();) {
               if (shorts.get(i) < lastKnownClientVersion)
                  shorts.remove(i);
               else
                  i++;
            }
            java.util.Collections.sort(shorts);
            return shorts.get(0);
         }
      }
      return -1;
   }
}

Read full topic

item.title: RS2 Client Version Checker?
item.dc:creator: @ruler ruler
item.description:
@ruler wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:25, topic:211431”][quote author=ruler link=topic=278498.msg2276748#msg2276748 date=1213487985]

[quote author=frank_ link=topic=278498.msg2275763#msg2275763 date=1213446356]

Here is one i wrote.

import java.util.ArrayList;

import org.apache.bcel.classfile.Method;
import org.apache.bcel.generic.ClassGen;
import org.apache.bcel.generic.Instruction;
import org.apache.bcel.generic.MethodGen;
import org.apache.bcel.generic.SIPUSH;

public class Version {
   public static final int lastKnownClientVersion = 500;

   public static int getVersion(ClassGenList cgs) {
      ClassGen client = cgs.findClass("client");
      for (Method m : client.getMethods()) {
         if (m.getName().equals("main")) {
            ArrayList<Short> shorts = new ArrayList<Short>();
            for (Instruction i : (new MethodGen(m, client.getClassName(), client.getConstantPool())).getInstructionList().getInstructions()) {
               if (i instanceof SIPUSH) {
                  shorts.add(((SIPUSH) i).getValue().shortValue());
               }
            }
            for (int i = 0; i < shorts.size();) {
               if (shorts.get(i) < lastKnownClientVersion)
                  shorts.remove(i);
               else
                  i++;
            }
            for (int i = 0; i < shorts.size(); i++) {
               if (shorts.get(i) == 503) {
                  shorts.remove(i);
                  break;
               }
            }
            for (int i = 0; i < shorts.size(); i++) {
               if (shorts.get(i) == 765) {
                  shorts.remove(i);
                  break;
               }
            }
            java.util.Collections.sort(shorts);
            return shorts.get(0);
         }
      }
      return -1;
   }
}

[/quote]terrible :\ and it will break on version 503 and 765

out of your element again. It will not break.
[/quote]ur a fucking moron, it will

the whole point is to only remove one of the values, so that if there is a duplicate, the other remains. also, i suggest you learn the collections api[/quote]
X2

out of your element again. It will not break.

I suggest you learn java.
Here is a good place to start:
http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/reallybigindex.html

item.title: RS2 Client Version Checker?
item.dc:creator: @nueb35 Nueb35
item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

some one gave an idea to look for a repetition of 503, or 765 and so i did, heres mine :

		int five = 0;
		int seven = 0;
		int ver = 0;

		while (search.hasMore("sipush"))
		{
			SIPUSH push = (SIPUSH) search.next("sipush");

			if (push.getValue().intValue() > 400 && push.getValue().intValue() < 1000)
			{
				if (push.getValue().intValue() == 503)
				{
					five++;
				}
				else if (push.getValue().intValue() == 765)
				{
					seven++;
				}
				else
				{
					ver = push.getValue().intValue();
				}
			}
		}

		if (five == 2)
		{
			ver = 503;
		}
		else if (seven == 2)
		{
			ver = 765;
		}

		System.out.println("  - Runescape version " + ver + " detected.");

“search” is an instruction searcher

Read full topic

import java.util.ArrayList;

import org.apache.bcel.classfile.Method;
import org.apache.bcel.generic.ClassGen;

            for (int i = 0; i < shorts.size();) {
               if (shorts.get(i) < lastKnownClientVersion)
                  shorts.remove(i);
               else

            for (int i = 0; i < shorts.size(); i++) {

                  break;

   }
}

[/quote]terrible :\ and it will break on version 503 and 765

out of your element again. It will not break.[/quote]ur a fucking moron, it will

the whole point is to only remove one of the values, so that if there is a duplicate, the other remains. also, i suggest you learn the collections api

item.title: RS2 Client Version Checker?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

Seeing it as I didn’t fully get your question, I think you mean is it possible to get the version out of the client? Try something like the following.

/** * Gets the version of the client. The client's version number * is pushed onto the stack via a sipush instruction, so this looks * for that certain instruction. * * @param client A ClassGen object of client. * @return The version found in the client, or -1 if it * was unable to be found. */ public static int getVersion(ClassGen client) { ArrayList<Integer> tmp = new ArrayList<Integer>(4); for(Instruction i : new MethodGen(client.containsMethod("main", "([Ljava/lang/String;)V"), "client", client.getConstantPool()).getInstructionList().getInstructions()) { if(i.getOpcode() == Constants.SIPUSH) { tmp.add(((ConstantPushInstruction) i).getValue().intValue()); } } for(int i : new int[] { 503, 765, 161, -11124 }) { tmp.remove((Integer) i); } if(tmp.size() == 1) { return tmp.get(0); } else { return -1; } }
frank_ helped me with that <3

If you were to mean what version the client is actually at; I used to use www.moparisthebest.com/rs/ for that, but seeing as that broke, my backup was always silab’s php script

Read full topic

item.title: RS2 Client Version Checker?
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

[quote=“ruler, post:20, topic:211431”]Here is one i wrote.

[code]
import java.util.ArrayList;

import org.apache.bcel.classfile.Method;
import org.apache.bcel.generic.ClassGen;
import org.apache.bcel.generic.Instruction;
import org.apache.bcel.generic.MethodGen;
import org.apache.bcel.generic.SIPUSH;

public class Version {
public static final int lastKnownClientVersion = 500;

public static int getVersion(ClassGenList cgs) {
ClassGen client = cgs.findClass(“client”);
for (Method m : client.getMethods()) {
if (m.getName().equals(“main”)) {
ArrayList shorts = new ArrayList();
for (Instruction i : (new MethodGen(m, client.getClassName(), client.getConstantPool())).getInstructionList().getInstructions()) {
if (i instanceof SIPUSH) {
shorts.add(((SIPUSH) i).getValue().shortValue());
}
}
for (int i = 0; i < shorts.size() {
if (shorts.get(i) < lastKnownClientVersion)
shorts.remove(i);
else
i++;
}
for (int i = 0; i < shorts.size(); i++) {
if (shorts.get(i) == 503) {
shorts.remove(i);
break;
}
}
for (int i = 0; i < shorts.size(); i++) {
if (shorts.get(i) == 765) {
shorts.remove(i);
break;
}
}
java.util.Collections.sort(shorts);
return shorts.get(0);
}
}
return -1;
}
}
[/code][/quote]terrible :\ and it will break on version 503 and 765

import java.util.ArrayList;

               if (i instanceof SIPUSH) {
